## Data  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 635, 560]]<|/det|>
speed of light in free space, \(c = 3.00\times 10^{8}\mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\) permeability of free space, \(\mu_{0} = 4\pi \times 10^{- 7}\mathrm{Hm}^{- 1}\) permittivity of free space, \(\epsilon_{0} = 8.85\times 10^{- 12}\mathrm{Fm}^{- 1}\) \((\frac{1}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}} = 8.99\times 10^{9}\mathrm{mF}^{- 1})\) elementary charge, \(e = 1.60\times 10^{- 19}\mathrm{C}\) the Planck constant, \(h = 6.63\times 10^{- 34}\mathrm{Js}\) unified atomic mass constant, \(u = 1.66\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of electron, \(m_{\mathrm{e}} = 9.11\times 10^{- 31}\mathrm{kg}\) rest mass of proton, \(m_{\mathrm{p}} = 1.67\times 10^{- 27}\mathrm{kg}\) molar gas constant, \(R = 8.31\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Avogadro constant, \(N_{\mathrm{A}} = 6.02\times 10^{23}\mathrm{mol}^{- 1}\) the Boltzmann constant, \(k = 1.38\times 10^{- 23}\mathrm{JK}^{- 1}\) gravitational constant, \(G = 6.67\times 10^{- 11}\mathrm{Nm}^{2}\mathrm{kg}^{- 2}\) acceleration of free fall, \(g = 9.81\mathrm{m s}^{- 2}\)

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 106, 556, 144]]<|/det|>
\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 160, 522, 178]]<|/det|>
\[W = \rho \Delta V\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 191, 532, 220]]<|/det|>
\[\phi = -\frac{Gm}{r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 228, 515, 246]]<|/det|>
\[p = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 256, 572, 287]]<|/det|>
\[p = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V} < c^2 >\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 295, 532, 313]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 327, 612, 365]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_0\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_0^2 - x^2)}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 375, 532, 410]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 428, 620, 448]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_1 + 1 / C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 465, 590, 485]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_1 + C_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 498, 522, 521]]<|/det|>
\[W = \frac{1}{2} QV\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 536, 590, 555]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_1 + R_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 572, 620, 591]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_1 + 1 / R_2 + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 606, 556, 625]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{x}_0\sin \omega t\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 641, 576, 660]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{x}_0\exp (-\lambda t)\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 675, 532, 710]]<|/det|>
\[\lambda = \frac{0.693}{t_{\frac{1}{2}}}\]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 72, 544, 89]]<|/det|>
## Section A  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[297, 102, 700, 121]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the spaces provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 133, 99, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 148, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 133, 479, 152]]<|/det|>
Define gravitational potential at a point.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 257, 146, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 257, 875, 291]]<|/det|>
The Moon may be considered to be an isolated sphere of radius \(1.74 \times 10^{3} \text{km}\) with its mass of \(7.35 \times 10^{22} \text{kg}\) concentrated at its centre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 181, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 303, 875, 352]]<|/det|>
A rock of mass \(4.50 \text{kg}\) is situated on the surface of the Moon. Show that the change in gravitational potential energy of the rock in moving it from the Moon's surface to infinity is \(1.27 \times 10^{7} \text{J}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 504, 875, 523]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 534, 181, 552]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 533, 875, 566]]<|/det|>
The escape speed of the rock is the minimum speed that the rock must be given when it is on the Moon's surface so that it can escape to infinity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 564, 813, 582]]<|/det|>
Use the answer in (i) to determine the escape speed. Explain your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[512, 730, 875, 750]]<|/det|>
<form>speed = ............................................ $\text{ms}^{-1}$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 763, 144, 781]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 763, 875, 796]]<|/det|>
The Moon in **(b)** is assumed to be isolated in space. The Moon does, in fact, orbit the Earth.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 794, 875, 827]]<|/det|>
State and explain whether the minimum speed for the rock to reach the Earth from the surface of the Moon is different from the escape speed calculated in **(b)**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[850, 902, 875, 920]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 856, 92]]<|/det|>
The product of the pressure \(p\) and the volume \(V\) of an ideal gas is given by the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 96, 571, 125]]<|/det|>
\[pV = \frac{1}{3} Nm< c^2>\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[868, 78, 945, 121]]<|/det|>
<form>Examiner's Use

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 129, 520, 149]]<|/det|>
where \(m\) is the mass of one molecule of the gas.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 160, 146, 179]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 160, 426, 179]]<|/det|>
State the meaning of the symbol

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 190, 170, 208]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 190, 217, 208]]<|/det|>
N,

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 250, 180, 268]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 250, 245, 268]]<|/det|>
\(< c^2>\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 308, 178, 327]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 308, 544, 327]]<|/det|>
The product \(pV\) is also given by the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 336, 551, 356]]<|/det|>
\[pV = NkT.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 365, 875, 400]]<|/det|>
Deduce an expression, in terms of the Boltzmann constant \(k\) and the thermodynamic temperature \(T\), for the mean kinetic energy of a molecule of the ideal gas.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 533, 875, 552]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 564, 144, 583]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 564, 510, 583]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 593, 180, 612]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 593, 514, 612]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 606, 843, 626]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[507, 757, 876, 777]]<|/det|>
<form>energy = .............................................. J [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 817, 875, 852]]<|/det|>
Explain whether the energy required to raise the temperature of the gas by 1.0 kelvin is now different from your answer in (i).

<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 875, 108]]<|/det|>
A charged particle of mass \(m\) and charge \(- q\) is travelling through a vacuum at constant speed \(v\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 875, 138]]<|/det|>
It enters a uniform magnetic field of flux density \(B\). The initial angle between the direction of motion of the particle and the direction of the magnetic field is \(90^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 149, 144, 168]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 148, 787, 170]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 303, 144, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 411, 323]]<|/det|>
The radius of the arc in (a) is \(r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 330, 677, 356]]<|/det|>
Show that the ratio \(\frac{q}{m}\) for the particle is given by the expression

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 356, 515, 389]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{q}{m} = \frac{\nu}{Br}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 542, 875, 560]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 571, 144, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 570, 875, 604]]<|/det|>
The initial speed \(v\) of the particle is \(2.0 \times 10^{7} \text{m} \text{s}^{-1}\). The magnetic flux density \(B\) is \(2.5 \times 10^{-3} \text{T}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 600, 593, 621]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 632, 181, 651]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 630, 520, 651]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[895, 77, 945, 120]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[235, 160, 710, 395]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[442, 457, 509, 476]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 488, 720, 507]]<|/det|>
